description: When expressed in base 3 and then interpreted in base 10, is a multiple of the original number.
example: 7 in base 3 is 21, which interpreted in base 10 is 21=3*7.
mathematica: lst = {0}; Do[If[Mod[FromDigits[IntegerDigits[n, 3]], n] == 0, AppendTo[lst, n]], {n, 10000}]; lst (* _Carl Najafi_, Aug 21 2011 *)
author: _Patrick De Geest_, April 1998
extensions: Example and better description from _Erich Friedman_ Jul 21 2001
